The source of this claim is the COVID Mo: a project of the Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget, which focuses on reducing federal deficits.
According to the COVID Money Tracker: out of the $4.1 trillion approved by Congress, approximately $3 trillion has been committed or disbursed.
However: determining the exact amount of unspent money is complicated, as some funds may take time to disburse and may not appear in the data immediately. Additionally, some allocated funds from earlier bills might never be spent.
